greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of n-digit primes with all digits distinct.
comment: For any base b the number of distinct-digit primes is finite. For base 10, the maximal distinct-digit prime is 987654103; for any larger prime at least two digits coincide. The number of distinct-digit integers is also finite, see A073531.
No such primes exist with 10 or more decimal digits, so a[x]=0 for x>=10. - _Labos Elemer_, Oct 25 2004; _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 25 2008
Entries checked by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 25 2008
mathematica: lst = {}; Do[p = Prime@ n; If[ Union[Length /@ Split@ Sort@ IntegerDigits@ p] == {1}, AppendTo[lst, p]], {n, PrimePi[10^9]}]; Table[ Length@ Select[lst, 10^n < # < 10^(n + 1) &], {n, 0, 9}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 25 2008 *)
program: def distinct_digs(n): s = str(n); return len(s) == len(set(s))
return sum(isprime(int("".join(p))) for p in permutations("0123456789", n) if p[0] != '0')
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 31)]) # _Michael S. Branicky_, Apr 20 2021
results.author: _Zak Seidov_, Aug 29 2002
